text: Unser Mund sei voll Lachens, BWV 110 is a cantata by Johann Sebastian Bach. The title means "May our mouth be filled with laughter and our tongue full of praise " in English. Bach wrote the cantata in 1725. Georg Christian Lehms wrote the text. It was written for Christmas day. == Music and structure== The cantata has seven movements. The first movement is based on the overture of Bach's fourth Orchestral suite. It is written for SATB chorus and soloists, three trumpets, a timpani, two oboes, two flutes, string ensemble, and basso continuo. # Chorus: # Aria: # Recitative: # Aria: # Duet: # Aria: # Choral: == References == Category:Church cantatas by Johann Sebastian Bach
title: Unser Mund sei voll Lachens, BWV 110
